name: Public nEUro
description:
Public nEUro is a GDPR-compliant repository and catalogue for human brain-imaging datasets (MRI, PET, EEG, MEG, etc.). The word “public” highlights that all metadata — such as all avaialable files, modality description, participant group (“healthy controls”/“patients”), scanner field strength, study description, DOI, licensing terms, and dataset versioning — are openly accessible and fully searchable. Access to the actual imaging data, however, remains controlled and requires user registration, institutional affiliation and agreement to a Data-User Agreement. This structure is aligned with European and international regulations that consider brain-imaging data as personal and subject to legal restrictions. A small subset of datasets in the repository are designated as fully open access.

Once you have registered, and requested a dataset and signed the DUA, you can download the dataset at any time via command line:

bash <(wget -qO- https://datacatalog.publicneuro.eu/api/cli.sh)

This will prompt you to enter
your email
your password
the PublicnEUro (PN) ID
the folder that you want to download - use / for the entire dataset

license.name: Mostly Data User Agreements, some CCBY
